newsitem.title: ITALY: CYCLING-TONKOV TRIMS GOTTI'S GIRO LEAD.
newsitem.headline: CYCLING-TONKOV TRIMS GOTTI'S GIRO LEAD.

text.p: Russian Pavel Tonkov closed to within 37 seconds of the Giro d'Italia lead on Wednesday after a tense duel with race leader Ivan Gotti in a 40- km time trial.
Ukrainian Sergei Gontchar averaged more than 50 kph to win by one minute eight seconds from Russian Yevgeny Berzin.
Gontchar clocked 47 minutes 18 seconds over the course from Baselga di Pine. Switzerland's Bruno Boscardin was third, one minute 31 seconds slower than the Ukrainian.

Tonkov finished 2:30 slower than the winner and the battle for the pink jersey reached a climax as Gotti clawed back seven of the 21 seconds he had lost to Tonkov during this 18th stage. Frenchman Luc Leblanc held third overall but lost more than one minute on Gotti after hitting a wall on a long descent.
